intro: Silene spaldingii, commonly known as Spalding's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and cliffs. It has hairy stems and leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Silene spaldingii is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
